company.taskMan.resource.user

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.taskMan.resource.Resource
      • company.taskMan.resource.ConcreteResource
        • company.taskMan.resource.user.User

  • public class User
extends ConcreteResource
    Users in our system are the people using it. The current user using the system should be logged in (since his credentials will be checked when accessing the system). User extends Resource, this way a user can be handled as a resource. A user can for example be reserved by a task.
    Author:
    Tim Van Den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String name,
            UserPrototype prototype)
        Construct a new user. No credentials are known. A user has no requirements or conflicts and is not limited by an availability period (however this could be possible in future adaptations of the system).
        Parameters:
        name - | The name of the new user
        prototype - | The prototype to inherit data from

    • Method Detail

      • getPermissions

        public java.util.List<UserPermission> getPermissions()
        Returns a full set of all permissions for this User.
        Returns:
        | a set of all permissions attached to this User's credentials

      • addCredential

        public boolean addCredential(UserCredential cred)
        Give this specific user a specific credential
        Parameters:
        cred - | The credential to add
        Returns:
        True if the user now has the credential, false otherwise

      • removeCredential

        public boolean removeCredential(UserCredential cred)
        Removes a specific credential from this user
        Parameters:
        cred - | The credential to remove
        Returns:
        True if the user no longer has the credential, false otherwise
